bibl.title: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, February 2, 1916

div1.p: Blue orders Carter to proceed to Whitney, North Carolina, to investigate the building of a dam for the reservoir.

div1.head: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, February 2, 1916
div1.opener:
JKC
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WMT
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
February 2, 1916.
Assistant Surgeon-General H. R. Carter,
U. S. Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Maryland.
Sir:
div1.p:
On the termination of your leave at Colleton, S.C.,
February 4--6, 1916, you are hereby directed to proceed
to Whitney, N. C., to make, in connection with the
studies of the relation of impounded waters to the pub-
lic health, an investigation of the dam of the reservoir
which it is contemplated to build in that place.

A report of the results of your investigation will
be made in duplicate to the Bureau.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, Rupert Blue
Surgeon-General.
The expenses incurred in carrying out the foregoing
instructions are hereby authorized.
BR Newton
Assistant Secretary.
RB
